name: Capital Metro
description: The primary public transportation provider for the Austin metropolitan area.
main_services: Fixed-route bus service, MetroRail, MetroRapid, and Pickup (on-demand transit).
cost: Standard local fare is $1.25 per trip or $2.50 for a Day Pass.
next_steps: Use the CapMetro Trip Planner or download the Umo app to purchase fares and plan routes.
hours: Mon–Fri 7 AM–8 PM, Sat/Sun 8 AM–5 PM

name: CARTS (Capital Area Rural Transportation System)
description: Provides regional transportation connecting rural communities to urban centers like Austin.
main_services: Country Bus (curb-to-curb), Interurban Coach (regional routes), and CARTS NOW on-demand service.
cost: Fares vary by zone; typically $2–$4 for local/regional trips. Half-price for seniors (65+).
next_steps: Call the Reservation Center at 512-478-7433 to book a ride (24-hour advance notice recommended).

name: Drive a Senior – ATX
description: A volunteer-based organization providing free transportation to older adults to maintain independence.
main_services: Volunteer-driven rides to medical appointments, grocery stores, and personal errands.
cost: Free for qualified and enrolled seniors (60+).
next_steps: Visit the website to complete an enrollment application or call the central office.

name: Senior Access
description: Provides free transportation and support services for seniors in Pflugerville and Round Rock.
main_services: Transportation to medical appointments, grocery shopping, and senior centers.
next_steps: Contact the Pflugerville branch to register for services.
address: 2498 E. Palm Valley Blvd, Round Rock, TX 78665

name: CapMetro Access
description: A shared-ride paratransit service for people whose disabilities prevent them from using regular bus/rail.
main_services: Curb-to-curb or door-to-door transit for eligible individuals.
next_steps: Apply for eligibility by calling 512-389-7501 for an interview and assessment.
hours: Reservations 24/7; Call Center Mon–Fri 8 AM–5 PM

name: Travis County Community Center at Pflugerville
description: Provides essential county services and social assistance to local residents.
main_services: Vehicle registration renewals and utility/rent assistance.
next_steps: Walk in for registration services or call for assistance requirements.

name: Chariot (formerly Drive a Senior Central Texas)
description: A non-profit providing non-emergency transportation for older adults in South/Central Austin.
main_services: Volunteer-led transportation for essential needs.
cost: Donation-based or free for low-income individuals.
next_steps: Call 512-445-5552 to inquire about eligibility and service area.

name: CapMetro Vanpool
description: A ride-sharing service for groups of commuters traveling to similar destinations.
main_services: Matching commuters into shared vanpools; provides the vehicle, fuel, and insurance.
cost: Monthly fee shared among riders (subsidized by CapMetro).
next_steps: Register on the Vanpool Matching Service website.

name: CapMetro Bikeshare
description: A city-wide electric bike-sharing system for short trips around Austin.
main_services: 24/7 access to e-bikes at over 75 stations.
next_steps: Download the CapMetro or Transit app to find and unlock bikes.

name: Get There ATX
provider: City of Austin Transportation and Public Works
description: A comprehensive information hub for all sustainable transportation options in Austin.
main_services: Trip planning resources for transit, biking, carpooling, and walking.
next_steps: Visit the website to explore mobility solutions.
address: Online resource managed by Austin City Hall

name: Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP)
provider: Texas Health and Human Services Commission
description: Provides financial assistance to low-income individuals and families to purchase nutritious food. Benefits are issued monthly via an EBT card.
main_services: Monthly food stipend, SNAP-Ed nutrition and lifestyle training
next_steps: Bring photo ID, Bill to prove residency, income docs

name: Housing Choice Voucher Program (Section 8)
description: A rental subsidy program where the government pays a portion of rent directly to private landlords.
main_services: Rental assistance for apartments, townhomes, or single-family homes, Housing problems, Housing
cost: Participants pay 30–40% of adjusted income; remainder covered by voucher

name: Medical Access Program (MAP)
provider: Travis County Healthcare District in partnership with CommUnityCare
description: Health coverage program for Travis County residents with low income or below 200% of the Federal Poverty Level, ensuring access to preventive care.
main_services: Preventive care, screenings, specialty care, prescriptions, dental services
cost: Free for those who qualify; sliding-scale fees $10–$25
next_steps: Bring proof of income, residency, and ID
address: Multiple locations: 1210 W Braker Ln; 2529 S First St; 2901 Montopolis Dr

name: Texas Health and Human Services
provider: State of Texas (Health and Human Services Commission)
description: Centralized agency managing public assistance programs including food, healthcare, and cash support for individuals and families in financial need.
main_services: SNAP, TANF, Medicaid, CHIP, WIC, nutrition education
next_steps: Call or visit website to apply online or schedule an appointment
address: 4601 W Guadalupe St; 1601 Rutherford Ln; 4616 Schieffer Ave; 1120 S IH 35

name: Communities in Schools of Central Texas (CIS)
provider: Communities in Schools in partnership with TEA and local school districts
description: School-based intervention program supporting students at risk of falling behind due to poverty.
main_services: Tutoring, academic monitoring, basic needs support, college/career readiness, XY Zone leadership program
cost: Free for students at participating schools
next_steps: Contact school counselor or CIS site coordinator
address: 3000 S IH 35 Frontage Rd #200, Austin, TX 78704

name: First Workers Day Labor Center
provider: City of Austin Economic Development Department
description: Safe environment for individuals experiencing homelessness to connect with employers for day labor jobs.
main_services: Job matching, wage negotiation, referrals for food and rent assistance
next_steps: Visit the center during operating hours

name: Customer Assistance Program (CAP)
provider: City of Austin Utilities / Austin Energy
description: Provides monthly discounts on utility bills for residents with low or fixed incomes.
main_services: Utility bill discounts, emergency financial assistance
next_steps: Call or visit website to apply online or schedule an appointment

name: Area Agency on Aging of the Capital Area (AAACAP)
provider: Texas Health and Human Services Commission
description: Regional agency supporting seniors (60+) and caregivers with food, medical equipment, and financial guidance.
main_services: Meals on Wheels coordination, care coordination, benefits counseling, wellness programs, ombudsman services
next_steps: Contact AAACAP and complete intake process
address: 6800 Burleson Rd, Bldg 310, Suite 165, Austin, TX 78744

name: Family Stabilization and Workforce Development Program
provider: City of Austin Economic Development Department & Austin Public Health
description: Provides financial relief and job training to residents, especially marginalized or immigrant communities affected by economic recessions.
main_services: Job training, small business support, legal support for migrants
cost: Free for low-income residents and small business owners
next_steps: Call or visit website to apply online or schedule an appointment
address: Austin City Hall, 301 W 2nd Street, Austin, TX 78701

name: Child Care Services (CCS) Scholarship
description: Financial aid covering a portion of child care costs at licensed or registered providers.
main_services: Subsidized child care for children up to age 13, or 19 with disabilities
cost: Parent share of cost based on income; scholarship covers remainder
next_steps: Complete the Eligibility Screener on the TX3C portal to join the waitlist
address: 9001 N IH 35 Ste 110; 3401 Webberville Rd Bldg 1000

name: Food Pantry
description: Provides food to meet basic nutritional needs. Includes an Assistance Application Form and Central Texas Food Bank form. Offers diapers and period supplies depending on availability. Drive-thru distribution for the first 275 families.
main_services: Emergency food, food pantry, baby supplies, personal care items
next_steps: Contact or go to the nearest location

name: Food Pantry & Diaper Distribution
description: Drive-thru food pantry and diaper distribution. Partners with Austin Diaper Bank and Austin Animal Center to provide diapers and pet food.
main_services: Emergency food, food pantry, baby supplies, pet food
next_steps: No appointment needed; drive-thru service
hours: Food Pantry: Tue & Thu 8:30 AM–10:30 AM; Diapers: 3rd Wed 8:30 AM–10:00 AM

name: Fresh for Less Mobile Markets
description: Mobile food markets offering Texas-grown produce and shelf-stable items at reduced prices. Open to anyone needing affordable fresh foods.
main_services: Reduced food prices, mobile food markets
next_steps: Check website for market locations and times

name: Food Pantry
provider: Society of Saint Vincent de Paul Diocesan Council of Austin
description: Walk-up food pantry providing healthy options including fresh produce, meat, bread, canned goods, and dairy.
main_services: Food pantry, emergency food, diapers & formula
next_steps: Contact or go to the nearest location

name: Pflugerville Mobile Food Pantry
description: Mobile food distribution bringing fresh produce and groceries to underserved neighborhoods in Pflugerville.
main_services: Drive-thru food distribution, SNAP application assistance
next_steps: No appointment needed; check online Food Map for dates

name: Central Texas Food Bank
description: Largest hunger-relief organization in Central Texas, distributing food through partner pantries and mobile distributions.
main_services: Free groceries, mobile food pantries, SNAP help, nutrition education
next_steps: Contact or go to the nearest location

name: Caritas Community Kitchen
description: Free hot lunch program serving anyone in need, no questions asked.
main_services: Hot meals, case management (eligible clients), pantry services
next_steps: Walk in during lunch hours

name: St. Ignatius Martyr Food Pantry
description: Weekly pantry providing groceries, produce, and basic supplies to families in need.
main_services: Free groceries, fresh produce, hygiene items, emergency assistance, Food
next_steps: No appointment needed; drive-thru service

name: Casa Marianella
description: A transitional shelter providing a welcoming environment for displaced immigrants and asylum seekers.
main_services: Emergency shelter, food, clothing, ESL classes, legal orientation
next_steps: Call 512-385-5571 to check for housing availability

name: World Relief Texas
description: Faith-based organization partnering with local churches to help immigrant families flourish.
main_services: Free adult English classes, youth and family services, immigration legal aid
cost: English classes free; legal services may have nominal fees
next_steps: Contact the Austin office via website to enroll

name: Workers Defense Project (Proyecto Defensa Laboral)
description: Empowers low-wage immigrant workers in the construction industry.
main_services: Wage theft assistance, workplace safety training, leadership development
cost: Free for members (nominal membership fee may apply)
next_steps: Attend a community meeting or call for a legal clinic appointment

name: AFSSA
description: Provides culturally grounded services to survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault, and trafficking, specifically serving Asian and immigrant communities.
main_services: Crisis intervention, language-specific advocacy, legal accompaniment, economic empowerment
next_steps: Call the 24-hour hotline for immediate support

name: Multicultural Refugee Coalition (MRC)
description: Creates livelihood opportunities for refugees through craft, food, and farming.
main_services: New Leaf Agriculture, Open Arms Studio, community education
next_steps: Contact MRC via website for vocational training opportunities

name: iACT Hands on Housing & Refugee Program
description: Supports refugees and low-income residents through ESL classes and cultural orientation.
main_services: ESL classes, cultural orientation
next_steps: Apply for ESL classes online
address: 2921 E 17th St, Building D, Austin, TX 78702

name: Posada Esperanza
description: Shelter for immigrant mothers and their children.
main_services: Transitional housing, after-school tutoring, medical appointment advocacy
next_steps: Email posadaesperanza@casamarianella.org for residency inquiries

name: El Buen Samaritano
description: Faith-based nonprofit supporting Latino and immigrant families through wraparound services.
main_services: Healthcare clinic, food pantry, ESL classes, computer literacy, benefits enrollment assistance
cost: Food and education free; clinic sliding scale
next_steps: Call or visit website to register for classes or clinic appointments
hours: Monday–Friday 8 AM–5 PM; Food Pantry Tue–Thu 9 AM–12 PM

name: Manos de Cristo
description: Empowers low-income individuals and immigrants through healthcare and education.
main_services: Affordable dental care, ESL classes, computer literacy, clothes closet
cost: Dental sliding scale; education and clothing free or low-cost
next_steps: Call the Dental Center or main office for registration
hours: Mon–Thu 8 AM–5 PM, Fri 8 AM–3 PM

name: Texas Civil Rights Project
description: Uses legal advocacy to defend the rights of marginalized communities across Texas.
main_services: Impact litigation for immigrant rights and systemic reform; limited direct representation in high-impact cases
cost: Free for clients accepted for representation
next_steps: Submit a legal intake request through their website

name: American Gateways (Austin Office)
description: Provides high-quality legal aid and education to low-income immigrants in Central Texas.
main_services: Legal orientation, asylum representation, Deportation Crisis Hotline
cost: Nominal fees based on income; some services pro bono
next_steps: Call 512-478-0546 ext. 200 for a consultation
address: 314 E Highland Mall Blvd, Suite 501, Austin, TX 78752

name: Refugee and Immigrant Center for Education and Legal Services (RAICES)
description: Provides legal and social services to underserved immigrant children, families, and refugees.
main_services: Deportation defense, bond payments, social service referrals, residency applications
cost: $40 consultation fee; many services free or low-cost
next_steps: Call 1-833-372-4237 to schedule an appointment
address: 3000 S IH-35 Frontage Rd, Suite 200, Austin, TX 78704

name: Immigration Legal Services
description: Provides professional legal representation to reunite families and promote self-sufficiency.
main_services: Residency and citizenship counseling, removal defense, family-based petitions
cost: $60 consultation fee; service fees 60–80% lower than private attorneys
next_steps: Call 512-651-6125 to schedule an appointment

name: Equal Justice Center
description: Protects workplace and immigration rights of low-income workers.
main_services: Free DACA application preparation, legal representation for employment-related immigration issues
cost: Free for DACA applications and low-income services
next_steps: Visit website for next DACA clinic or call for screening
address: 314 E Highland Mall Blvd, Suite 255, Austin, TX 78752

name: Texas RioGrande Legal Aid (TRLA) Austin Office
description: Primary provider of free civil legal aid to low-income residents in Southwest Texas.
main_services: Civil rights, employment, and family immigration representation
next_steps: Call TRLA hotline at 800-369-9270 for screening

name: ICE Fuera de Austin (ICE Out of Austin)
description: Community advocacy program focused on ending immigrant detention and promoting enforcement awareness.
main_services: ICE interaction education, family preparedness toolkits, Know Your Rights outreach
next_steps: Visit website for materials or join advocacy meetings

name: UT Immigration Law Clinic
provider: University of Texas School of Law
description: Law school clinic where students represent vulnerable immigrants under faculty supervision.
main_services: Removal defense, asylum representation, domestic violence protection cases
next_steps: Call for intake availability (varies by semester)
address: 727 E Dean Keeton St, Austin, TX 78705

name: Volunteer Legal Services
description: Coordinates pro bono legal assistance from private attorneys for low-income residents.
main_services: Legal clinics for civil matters, including immigration-related family law and domestic violence protections
next_steps: Attend a scheduled virtual or in-person clinic
address: 1033 La Posada Dr, Suite 370, Austin, TX 78752

name: Community Code Jam - Austin
description: A hands-on computer science family engagement event for K–12 students and their families. Activities include coding, AI, computational thinking, and cybersecurity stations with volunteer instructors.
main_services: Recreational activity, computer learning, coding stations
next_steps: Sign-up sheet

name: Austin Nature & Science Center
description: Hands-on nature and science facility offering exhibits, wildlife displays, trails, and educational programs for children, families, and adults.
main_services: Nature exhibits, wildlife rehabilitation, Dino Pit, trails, outdoor exploration
next_steps: Go and have fun
address: Public Parking: 2389 Stratford Dr, Austin, TX 78746; Center: 301 Nature Center Dr, Austin, TX 78746
hours: Mon–Sat 9 AM–5 PM; Sun 12 PM–5 PM

name: Alliance Children's Garden
description: A children’s garden divided into four themed rooms reflecting Austin’s culture and environment, including Hill Country Garden and Skyline Garden.
main_services: Kids' play, children's playground
next_steps: Go and have fun

name: Austin Public Library – Central Library
description: A nationally recognized library featuring a rooftop garden, kids’ floor, events, and study spaces.
main_services: Reading, homework help, free programs, ESL-friendly environment
next_steps: Go to get your free library card, explore books and programs
address: 710 W Cesar Chavez St, Austin, TX 78701

name: Zilker Eagle Mini-Train
provider: City of Austin Parks & Recreation + Zilker Train Foundation
description: A family-friendly miniature train offering short rides around Zilker Park.
main_services: Mini-train rides, park sightseeing, family photo opportunities
next_steps: Go and have fun
address: Zilker Park, 2100 Barton Springs Rd, Austin, TX

name: Free First Sunday at the Bullock Texas State History Museum
description: Monthly event offering free admission to exhibits with hands-on activities for kids and families.
main_services: Free museum entry, family craft stations, interactive exhibits
next_steps: Go on the first Sunday of the month

name: Dino Pit at Austin Nature & Science Center
description: A free outdoor fossil dig where kids can uncover replica dinosaur bones and learn about paleontology.
main_services: Fossil dig pit, educational displays, nature trails, wildlife exhibits
next_steps: Go and have fun
hours: Mon–Sat 9 AM–5 PM; Sun 12 PM–5 PM

name: Pease Park
provider: Pease Park Conservancy + City of Austin
description: Historic park with trails, playgrounds, splash pads, and public art including the popular troll sculpture.
main_services: Playgrounds, water play area, trails, picnic areas, art installations
next_steps: Go and have fun

name: Lady Bird Johnson Wildflower Center
description: Nature and education center featuring native plant gardens, scenic trails, nature play areas, and rotating exhibits.
main_services: Nature trails, gardens, family activities, seasonal events
cost: Adults $12; Seniors $10; Students $8–$10; Youth $6; Under 5 free
next_steps: Go and have fun

name: Texas School for the Blind and Visually Impaired
description: A statewide education and resource center for blind, low‑vision, and DeafBlind students.
main_services: K–12 specialized education, orientation & mobility training, assistive technology, family support services, event accessibility planning
cost: Publicly funded (no cost to families for core services)
next_steps: Visit website for materials or call

name: Austin Lighthouse for the Blind
description: Support center offering training, employment, and independence‑building services for blind and visually impaired individuals.
main_services: Job training, employment programs, assistive technology training, independent living skills, community support and advocacy
next_steps: Go and explain your needs
address: 4512 S Pleasant Valley Rd, Austin, TX 78744

name: All Blind Children of Texas
description: Provides enrichment programs, resources, and support for blind and visually impaired children and their families.
main_services: Educational enrichment, family support, community programs
next_steps: Contact or go to the nearest location

name: Texas School for the Deaf (TSD)
description: A statewide school offering comprehensive education and community programs for Deaf and Hard‑of‑Hearing students.
main_services: K–12 education, ASL‑based instruction, family support, community events
next_steps: Contact or go to the nearest location

name: AISD Deaf & Hard of Hearing + Translation Services
description: Provides communication access, ASL interpreting, and translation services for students and families.
main_services: ASL interpreting, translation & interpretation, DHH classroom support, accessibility services
cost: Free for AISD students and families
next_steps: Contact or go to the nearest location

name: Bilinguistics Speech & Language Services
description: A bilingual speech‑language clinic specializing in multilingual communication support.
main_services: Bilingual speech therapy, language assessments, communication support for multilingual families
next_steps: Contact or go to the nearest location

name: Austin Public Library Accessibility Services
description: Offers ASL‑interpreted events, large‑print books, Braille materials, assistive technology, multilingual services, and accessible computer stations.
main_services: ASL‑interpreted events, large‑print & Braille collections, screen readers, magnification devices, multilingual materials, accessible computers
next_steps: Go and explore books and programs
address: 710 W César Chávez St, Austin, TX 78701
hours: Mon–Thu 10 AM–8 PM; Fri–Sun 10 AM–6 PM

name: Easterseals Central Texas
description: Provides disability services, assistive technology, and accessibility support for children and adults.
main_services: Assistive technology evaluations, disability support, early childhood intervention, workforce & independent living support
next_steps: Visit website for materials or call

name: Texas Talking Book Program
description: Provides free audiobooks, Braille books, and accessible reading technology for people who are blind, low‑vision, or have reading disabilities.
main_services: Free audiobooks by mail, digital talking book players, Braille books, BARD mobile app
next_steps: Contact or go to the nearest location

name: AISD Multilingual & Parent Support Services
description: Helps families enroll in school, supports English learners, and assists with school integration.
main_services: School enrollment help, ESL support, bilingual/dual-language programs, parent support specialists
next_steps: Contact or go to the nearest location

name: El Buen Samaritano Education Services
description: Provides English classes, after-school programs, and family education support for immigrant and bilingual families.
main_services: After-school tutoring, ESL classes, parent education, help navigating school systems
next_steps: Contact or go to the nearest location

name: Communities In Schools (CIS)
description: Works inside schools to help students succeed academically and socially, especially those facing barriers.
main_services: School integration support, tutoring, mentoring, attendance support, family case management
next_steps: Visit website for materials or call

name: English @ Work & Family Pathways
description: Provides English classes, family literacy programs, and school-readiness support for parents and children.
main_services: ESL classes, family literacy programs, school readiness support, parent education
next_steps: Visit website for materials or call
address: 835 N Pleasant Valley Rd, Austin, TX 78702

name: Boys & Girls Clubs – After-School Programs
provider: Boys & Girls Clubs of the Austin Area
description: Safe, structured after-school programs focused on academics, social skills, and youth development.
main_services: Homework help, after-school care, STEM programs, reading programs, youth leadership activities
next_steps: Contact or go to the nearest location

name: The Excel Center (Adult High School)
description: A free public charter school for adults 18+ to earn their high school diploma, plus job training and college support.
main_services: High school diploma, career certifications, college application support, life coaching, childcare
next_steps: Contact or go to the nearest location

name: Adult Education & Career Pathways
description: Provides adult education, English classes, GED support, and career-readiness programs.
main_services: GED prep, ESL classes, career coaching, job readiness training, help applying to training programs
next_steps: Visit website for materials or call
address: 835 N Pleasant Valley Rd, Austin, TX 78702

name: Workforce Solutions Career Centers
description: Austin’s main workforce agency offering job training, certifications, and career counseling.
main_services: Job training, career coaching, resume help, interview prep, scholarships for training programs
next_steps: Go and look at all the services they offer

name: ACC Adult Education
description: Offers free adult education classes including GED prep, English classes, career pathways, and college-readiness support.
main_services: GED prep, adult basic education, ESL classes, career training pathways, college application help
next_steps: Contact or go to the nearest location as spots are limited

name: AVANCE Adult Education
description: Provides adult education, English classes, GED support, and family-focused learning programs.
main_services: GED prep, English classes, parent education, workforce readiness, school/college navigation support
next_steps: Contact or go to the nearest location

name: I Belong in Austin
description: Austin’s main emergency rental assistance program for residents facing eviction or housing loss.
main_services: Financial aid for rent, moving, storage, and relocation
next_steps: Apply on the website portal, typically open the first week of the month
hours: Applications open Feb 1 at 8 AM to Feb 7 at 5 PM

name: Capital IDEA
description: Pays for tuition, books, and childcare while adults earn an associate degree or certification at ACC. Ideal for immigrants entering high‑paying careers.
main_services: Degree pathways, tuition assistance, childcare support
next_steps: Must be 18+, have HS diploma/GED, live in eligible counties, and meet income guidelines
address: 6101 Highland Campus Dr, Austin, TX 78752; 3401 Webberville Rd, Austin, TX 78702

name: Financial Health Pathways
description: Provides financial education, savings programs, and free financial coaching for Austin residents.
main_services: Savings programs, budgeting help, credit building, debt management, financial goal setting
next_steps: Sign up at financialhp.org

name: Catholic Charities (Frost Bank Academy)
description: Offers 'Money Smart' banking classes teaching safe banking, mobile banking, and how to choose the right account.
main_services: Basic banking classes, mobile banking training
next_steps: Sign up at ccctx.org/financial-stability under 'Free Financial Education'

name: Star of Texas Credit Union
description: A CDFI bank supporting people excluded from traditional banks. Offers low‑interest emergency loans and services for people without SSNs.
main_services: Banking without SSN, emergency loans, alternative loans
next_steps: Sign up at staroftexascu.org

name: Mission Asset Fund (Lending Circles)
description: Organized social lending circles offering 0% interest loans while building credit. Designed for immigrants and low‑income individuals.
main_services: 0% interest loans, credit building
next_steps: Use the MAF Provider Map at MissionAssetFund.org/Lending-Circles

name: American Consumer Credit Counseling (ACCC)
description: Provides financial education and debt management services including bankruptcy counseling and student loan support.
main_services: Credit counseling, debt management program, bankruptcy counseling, housing & student loan counseling
cost: Initial counseling free; DMP enrollment $39; DMP monthly $25; bankruptcy courses $39–$49
next_steps: Go and explain your needs

name: VITA (Volunteer Income Tax Assistance)
description: IRS‑certified volunteers provide free basic income tax preparation and electronic filing for underserved communities.
main_services: Federal & state tax prep, e‑filing, tax credit guidance
next_steps: Bring photo ID, SSN/ITIN, income docs, health insurance info, banking info; both spouses must be present if married
address: Local community centers, libraries, schools, malls
hours: Mid‑January to April 15; many evening hours

name: Prosper Financial Wellness
description: Free financial‑wellness program offering retirement planning, budgeting, and long‑term financial coaching.
main_services: Retirement planning, financial coaching, budgeting, savings plans, benefits help, free tax prep
next_steps: Go and explain your needs

name: Digital Literacy Training
description: Provides free technology training to bridge the digital divide, offering hands-on support for email setup, internet research, online applications, and basic cybersecurity.
main_services: Email setup, internet research, online applications, cybersecurity training
next_steps: Visit the DeWitty Center for walk-in assistance or call for class schedules

name: Prosper Centers
description: Provides free financial advice for households earning under $85,000 (2–4 people) or individuals earning under $60,000.
main_services: Credit building, budgeting, tax filing assistance
next_steps: Make an appointment online or by phone
address: North: 5900 Airport Blvd; South: 2900 S IH Frontage Rd
hours: Mon–thu 9:00 AM–8:00 PM, Fri-Sat 9:00 AM–4:00 PM

name: Austin Public Library – Cultural Norms Support
description: Helps newcomers learn local customs and language through ESL Conversational Circles and cultural events like Welcoming Week and Scoops & Stories.
main_services: ESL conversation circles, cultural events, storytelling programs
next_steps: Visit APL or the Immigrant Affairs page for upcoming events

name: Tech Services & Classes
description: Offers public computer access and guided classes for basic to advanced technology skills.
main_services: Email setup, scam identification, search engine use, printing and faxing services
next_steps: Check the APL Events Calendar for tech workshops
address: 710 W César Chávez St, Austin, TX 78701
hours: Mon–Thu 9 AM–8 PM; Fri–Sat 9 AM–5 PM; Sun 12 PM–5 PM

name: Emergency Management Preparedness Program
provider: Austin Office of Homeland Security and Emergency Management
description: Provides residents with tools and training to prepare for natural and man-made disasters.
main_services: Emergency training, family preparedness planning, multilingual kits and workshops
next_steps: Download the Ready Central Texas App and printable emergency plan

name: Integral Care
description: Primary public provider for mental health support, specializing in low-income and immigrant communities.
main_services: 24/7 crisis hotline, counseling, psychiatric care, Mental Health First Aid training
next_steps: Call the 24/7 Crisis Line at 512-472-HELP
hours: Walk-in clinics Mon–Fri 8 AM–4 PM; Crisis Line 24/7

name: Home Repair & Maintenance Workshops
description: Teaches homeowners and renters how to maintain their homes and avoid costly repairs.
main_services: DIY plumbing, electrical safety, weatherization, tool use
next_steps: Check the ReStore Calendar for workshop dates
address: 500 W Ben White Blvd, Austin, TX 78704

name: Consumer Protection & Scam Awareness
provider: Better Business Bureau (BBB) of Central Texas
description: Protects consumers from fraud and identity theft through education and reporting tools.
main_services: Scam Tracker, fraud workshops, phishing and phone scam education
next_steps: Visit the BBB Scam Tracker to report or view scams

name: Neighborhood Centers (Community Services)
description: One-stop centers helping low-income residents apply for local, state, and federal assistance programs.
main_services: Help applying for SNAP, Medicaid, CHIP, MAP, and utility assistance
next_steps: Call the nearest Neighborhood Center for an appointment
